title: Soraka is really strong, just feels really weak.
body:
I tried out support Soraka for the first time, and while she's amazing, she just feels really weak.
When you look at a game with Nami and her ADC, Nami's making water fly everywhere and everyone gets CC'd while the ADC cleans up. Her buff ability even has three shiny orbs which explode in water.
With Janna, she uses her Q and everyone goes flying, but her W and E are harder to notice.
With Soraka, you have her Q, which does very little damage compared to everything else, and can make green sparkles cover the ADC

All her power is in her W and while Nami and Janna look like they're working in tandem with their ADCs, Soraka looks like she's just spamming W and the ADC is doing all the work, when in reality it's because of her the ADC's HP bar never moves down.

I think Soraka is strong but just doesn't look that way, or feel rewarding. Rito pls fix.

replies.body:
It's just the reality of heal bots sadly.

You can have OP heals but you will never seem like you're doing much until you save someone from dying.
Pretty much. I hope they make her feel more rewarding someday

her sustain already makes her extremely difficult to deal with , as its much higher then any other healing support , even taric , and her spells have been reworked to give her more zone control . buffing her for higher damage and/or effects would make her overpowered.  otherwise they would have to drop her heal ratios , and then she would just be like sona. If you want more poke and damage then use sona ect. you cant have both...

they already made her heals more costly then they were before , by adding a self hp cost to it , and removed her ability to restore mana as well. i dont see anyway you can alter her further without changing her kit completely and removing her identity as a healer.

That has nothing to do with the post at all. In fact, the title specifically says Soraka is strong.

What I'm saying is, the action of healing isn't as flashy as the other supports and the effect is present but harder to notice.

so all you actually want is just a visual/particle update . although its pretty safe to assume most people realize that soraka is healing someone , when you attack them and their hp just goes right back up. You know your healing , your carry knows your healing them.. what difference does it make ...

Not really, most people would agree it would get lost the chaos of most team fights, Soraka spamming W whenever the carries HP goes down is no where as impressive looking or rewarding as hitting Nami or Janna's Q + W, and buffing at just the right time (because they're temporary compared to permanent HP, in fact even their heals are flashy because they affect the enemy too.)

Soraka has her ult which is as rewarding as Nami and Janna's ults, her E is extremely long in cooldown and gets covered up since it's flat on the ground, and her Q is the easiest to notice but at the same time it does the least for everyone else and is mainly for healing herself

In fact, I've done several things that should've been rewarding, but didn't feel that way, and that's:
Rooting 3 enemy champions in the same E without other CC
Stealing dragon alone with a single Q and nothing else from a Yi
Healing all 5 champs with ulti
Healing top lane and getting an assist
Saving my carry from death

Only saving my carry from death and stealing dragon felt a bit rewarding, and when I say 'from death' I mean when he/she is already really low so sometimes I get tempted to intentionally wait for his/her hp to get low so I can heal it but I never follow through.

The ADC and your team might not notice it too much but don't worry the enemy always do!
A lot/almost every Raka game I play, the enemy team is almost always like "omfg just die" or "stupid ass purple unicorn!"
Altho ofc when you're attacking someone and there health never moves down you're gonna notice lol

LOL I played two games, and in one I stole drag with Q (god I feel so bad for the Yi who tried to solo and lost so much HP from it, before he thought he'd get out alive using smite.), so definitely I know how that feels. I don't notice when their health never moves down unless I specifically look for it though, I get lost in the battle and focus on hitting my Qs (which benefit myself more than anyone because of how much it heals and how little it deals), and keeping in range for W.

I think this is what Riot meant when they said healing is unfun. I think they should just give Soraka some independent power (Janna has self peel, Nami has self sustain, Soraka isn't left with much except her Q heals), and push her in the direction of being like Vladimir except less tank -mage and more support-mage.
